title: Saul Anointed as King
summary: In 1 Samuel 10, Samuel anoints Saul privately and gives him signs to confirm God’s choice. The Spirit of God comes upon Saul, and he prophesies. Later, Saul is publicly chosen by lot, but hides until brought forward.

faq.question: What signs confirmed Saul’s calling?
faq.answer: He met specific people, received provisions, and prophesied—just as Samuel had predicted.

faq.question: How did Saul react to being chosen publicly?
faq.answer: He hid among the baggage, showing his humility or fear.
